name: 施岳廷
objective: This course aims to teach students the fundamental knowledge of glass materials. It will start with the principle of glass formation from thermodynamics and kinetics perspectives. Then the structure of several widely used glass systems will be introduced. Afterward, important properties of glass, including mechanical, dynamical, optical, electrical properties, and chemical durability will be discussed.
schedule:
1. Glass Formation Principles 
2. Glass Microstructure: Phase Separation and Liquid Immiscibility
3. Glass Compositions and Structures
4. The Viscosity of Glass
5. Density and Thermal Expansion
6. Heat Capacity and Thermal Conductivity
7. Mechanical Properties 
8. Transport Properties
9. Chemical Durability
10. Optical Properties
11. Fundamentals of Glass Making
12. Glass Characterization Techniques
13. Modeling of Glass
materials:
[1] J.E. Shelby, Introduction to Glass Science and Technology, Royal Society of Chemistry, 2020.
[2] A.K. Varshneya, J.C. Mauro, Fundamentals of Inorganic Glasses, Elsevier Science, 2019.
[3] H. Scholze, M. Lakin, Glass: Nature, Structure, and Properties, Springer-Verlag, 1991.
[4] M. Affatigato, Modern Glass Characterization, Wiley, 2015.
[5] J.D. Musgraves, J. Hu, L. Calvez, Springer Handbook of Glass, Springer International Publishing, 2019.
